title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: This justly celebrated public-house, which is said to have looked more like a farm-house on a country path way than a city inn, has long since disappeared, and none of the local histories give its exact position. This, according to those who still remember it, is the site of the New Register House, in the rear of the old Register House ; and it is approached from

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: 56 LITERARY LANDMARKS OF EDINBURGH West Register Street by the narrow alley running now between the New Register House and the new Caf6 Royal. This little paved foot-path was, in the time of Ambrose's, a green lane called Gabriel's Road, leading diagonally across the New Town to Silvermills, and it is said still to claim its ancient privilege of a right of way.
